intro: Leucocoma, commonly known as the white orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, white or pale-colored flowers that often have a delicate, fragrant scent. They are native to various regions in South America, particularly in the Andean mountain ranges. Leucocoma species typically grow in high-altitude environments, where they thrive in cool, moist conditions. Their botanical features include long, slender stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence.
